text: i noticed the documentation has changed.  i'm having trouble finding where things like "inline_text" and other similar tags are documented in this new layout -- would you be able to point me to that?
Hi Trey, I had responded about this in your other thread -<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C960Q64G4/p1584708356086500?thread_ts=1525354776.000017&cid=C960Q64G4>
thanks jon.  that link still doesn't go to inline_text tag is it because it's not an offically supported tag?
i was wondering if there were other tags like it that i might not be aware of?
also, is there any other way to get inline text editing in a custom dnd module?

as stated in the other thread, at this time no, that IS how you get it, but right now the page editor does not have the capability. It may in the future.

You are correct this should be documented as a tag, and that it doesn’t appear to be in the page for that.

The inline_text tag and the module version of the tag are somewhat the same thing.
The only difference is that the text module is an actual module, and the text tag is a true HubL tag. The tag can be used within a module, where as the module version cannot be placed inside of a module because modules can’t be nested.

The purpose of the inline_text tag is that it adds wrapping code around the output so that the page editor can make it editable. At this time since the page editor does not take advantage of this for custom modules  it doesn’t do anything. That could change in the future.
